intro: Corynostylis rufotomentosa, commonly known as the red-hairy corynostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its hairy, reddish stems and small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in coastal heathlands and is often found in sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
